sen.j: 博奕岬（ばくちみさき）は、京都府舞鶴市瀬崎に属し、日本海（若狭湾西部）に面する岬。
sen.e: Located in Sezaki, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, Bakuchi Misaki Cape overlooks the Japan Sea (the western part of Wakasa Bay).
Located in Sezaki, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, Bakuchi Misaki Cape overlooks the Japan Sea (the western part of Wakasa Bay).
Located in Sezaki, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, Bakuchi Misaki Cape overlooks the Japan Sea (the western part of Wakasa Bay).

sen.j: 北緯35度33分6秒、東経135度20分34秒。
sen.e: Bakuchi Misaki Cape lies at 35º33'6'' north latitude and 135º20'34'' east longitude.
Bakuchi Misaki Cape lies at 35º33'6'' north latitude and 135º20'34'' east longitude.
Bakuchi Misaki Cape lies at 35º33'6'' north latitude and 135º20'34'' east longitude.

sen.j: 大浦半島の北西端にあり、舞鶴湾の湾口の東側に位置する。
sen.e: Bakuchi Misaki Cape lies in the northwest edge of the Oura peninsular and is located to the east of the mouth of the Maizuru bay.
Bakuchi Misaki Cape lies in the northwest edge of the Oura peninsular and is located to the east of the mouth of the Maizuru bay.
Bakuchi Misaki Cape lies in the northwest edge of the Oura Peninsula and is located to the east of the mouth of the Maizuru Bay.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: また、先端には博奕岬灯台が設置されている。
sen.e: The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse is installed at the tip of the Bakuchi Misaki Cape.
The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse is installed at the tip of the Bakuchi Misaki Cape.
The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse is installed at the tip of the Bakuchi Misaki Cape.

sen.j: 若狭湾国定公園に含まれる。
sen.e: The Bakuchi Misaki Cape belongs to the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park.
The Bakuchi Misaki Cape belongs to the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park.
The Bakuchi Misaki Cape belongs to the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 赤い海食崖が、険しく聳え立つ。
sen.e: A steep red coastal cliff rises.
A steep red coastal cliff rises.
A steep red coastal cliff rises.

sen.j: その個性ある地名は、いずれも力自慢だった龍神（女神）とクジラの大王が、どちらが強いか知恵比べしようと、ここで囲碁で勝負した、との言い伝えによる（を参照）。
sen.e: The unique name of Bakuchi (gaming) is originated from legend that a dragon goddess and a whale king, both proud in their strength, played a game of go to have a battle of wits with each other (reference).
The unique name of Bakuchi (gaming) originates from a legend that a dragon goddess and a whale king, both proud of their strength, played a game of go in a game of wits (reference).
The unique name of Bakuchi (gaming) originates from a legend that a dragon goddess and a whale king, both proud of their strength, played a game of go in a game of wits (reference).

sen.j: 岬への海岸は、北半の花崗岩に対し南半は輝緑岩と、白と暗褐色にクッキリ分かれている。
sen.e: The coast to the cape has two distinct colors, white and dark brown colors: the northern half part is made of granite and the southern half part is made of diabase.
The coast to the cape has two distinct colors, white and dark brown colors: the northern half part is made of granite and the southern half part is made of diabase.
The coast to the cape has two distinct colors, white and dark brown colors: the northern half part is made of granite and the southern half part is made of diabase.

sen.j: 前述の伝説も、これに拠ることだろう。
sen.e: This feature also supports the aforementioned legend.
The legend most likely stems from these features as well.
The legend most likely stems from these features as well.
The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse stands on the cape.
The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse stands on the cape.
The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse stands on the cape.

sen.j: 海抜129m、光達28海里、初点灯1925年。
sen.e: The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse is 129 meters above sea level, and the visible distance is about 52 km; the lighthouse was first lit up in 1925.
sen.cmt: １海里１８５２メートルとして、２８海里を約５２キロとしました。
sen.e: The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse is 129 meters above sea level, and the visible distance is about 52 km; the lighthouse was first lit in 1925.
The Bakuchi-misaki Cape lighthouse is 129 meters above sea level, and the visible distance is about fifty-two kilometers; the lighthouse was first lit in 1925.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 現在、岬の周囲は自衛隊の管理地となっている。
sen.e: At present, the area around the cape is under the control of the Japan Self-Defense Forces.
At present, the area around the cape is under the control of the Japan Self-Defense Forces.
At present, the area around the cape is under the control of the Japan Self-Defense Forces.
